summary: Mortgage lenders generally use credit scores to determine how risky it is to lend to a potential borrower. But what about the 45 million Americans who don't have a credit score? Using alternative data—such as rental payment history—is an option for mortgage lenders that has benefits and risks. title: Mortgage Lending: Use of Alternative Data Is Limited but Has Potential Benefits
